alert.note: Alert for Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 10:09AM MST until December 28 at 9:31PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...St Joe River at Calder. * WHEN...Now through this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Bear Creek will begin to back up from the St Joe River and may start to spill into the town of Calder, flooding the low spots in yards, roads and parking lots. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage by this evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM PST.
